 It is our policy to abide by all federal, state and local laws prohibiting employment discrimination based on a person's race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy, childbirth, physical disability, mental and/or intellectual disability, age, military status, veteran status (including protected veterans), marital status, registered domestic partner or civil union status, familial status, gender (including sex stereotyping and gender identity or expression), medical condition (including, but not limited to, cancer related or HIV/AIDS related), genetic information, sexual orientation, or any other protected status.

title: Servicetekniker
description:
Xylem is a Fortune 500 global water solutions company dedicated to advancing sustainable impact and empowering the people who make water work every day. As a leading water technology company with 23,000 employees operating in over 150 countries, Xylem is at the forefront of addressing the world's most critical water challenges. We invite passionate individuals to join our team, dedicated to exceeding customer expectations through innovative and sustainable solutions.
   

  

**Servicetekniker till Xylem i Sundbyberg – var med och lös framtidens vattenutmaningar!**
 Vill du ha ett arbete där du får använda din tekniska kompetens, arbeta praktiskt och bidra till hållbara lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos oss på Xylem får du chansen att arbeta i en organisation där innovation, ansvar och laganda står i centrum.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som servicetekniker arbetar du med installation och renovering av olika produkter ute hos våra kunder. Du utför felsökning, reparationer, installationer, montering och ombyggnader av våra olika produkter och anläggningar. Våra produkter sträcker sig från pumpar och omrörare till turbiner och pumpstationer med tillhörande el- och styrutrustning.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära våra kunder och är en viktig del i att säkerställa att våra lösningar fungerar effektivt och pålitligt.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* Interna utbildningar för att du ska växa i din roll och lära känna våra produkter
* Möjlighet till kompetensutveckling och karriär inom Xylem
* God ersättning och förmåner
* En välutrustad servicebil med alla nödvändiga verktyg och utrustning
* Egen väska med personlig skyddsutrustning
* Tillgång till personliga IT-hjälpmedel (PC, smartphone och iPad)


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är självgående, ansvarstagande och serviceinriktad. Du trivs med ett varierande arbete, är flexibel och fattar egna beslut i det dagliga arbetet. Du har lätt för att samarbeta, och du motiveras av att hitta lösningar och ge god service till både kollegor och kunder.
   

  

**Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har**
* Utbildning inom VVS, VA eller liknande område
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom VA, VVS eller liknande teknisk bransch
* Erfarenhet av montering, installation och felsökning i tekniska system
* Tekniskt och mekaniskt intresse samt vana vid problemlösning
* B-körkort är ett krav


 Arbetstiden är vardagar kl. 7–16. Jourtjänst på kvällar och helger kan förekomma.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Serviceorganisationen finns på 12 platser i Sverige, från Gällivare i norr till Malmö i söder. Tillsammans med våra kvalitetsprodukter erbjuder vi våra kunder långsiktiga, hållbara lösningar för deras pumpbehov – allt från reparationer och installationer till montage, svetsjobb samt el- och automationsarbeten.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Vid frågor eller för mer information är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

**Daniel Långberg, HR** 
 , 070-822 74 57.
   

  

 Ansökan sker via länken, men du är också välkommen att ringa och presentera dig närmare.
   

  

**Fackliga Representanter**
**Mikael Lövås, Unionen** 
 , och
 **Rocio Piazuelo-Carrasco, Sveriges Ingenjörer** 
 , tel. 08-475 60 00.
   

  

 Join the global Xylem team to be a part of innovative technology solutions transforming water usage, conservation, and re-use. Our products impact public utilities, industrial sectors, residential areas, and commercial buildings, with a commitment to providing smart metering, network technologies, and advanced analytics for water, electric, and gas utilities. Partner with us in creating a world where water challenges are met with ingenuity and dedication; where we recognize the power of inclusion and belonging in driving innovation and allowing us to compete more effectively around the world.

title: (Associate) Portfolio Monitoring Officer – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Operations Directorate (OPS) – Equity Growth Capital & Project Finance Department (EGPF) – EIC Investment Services Division (3-EIC) – EIC Operational & Business Support Unit (OBS) –
 **(Associate** 
****) Portfolio Monitoring Officer\*****
 .
   

  

**This is a full time temporary position at grade 4/5.**
**The term of this contract will be 3 years.**
* Internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Lending Operations


***The existence of this position is linked to the EIC Partnership Advisory which is foreseen until 31.12.2035.***
***Panel interviews are anticipated for end of November 2025.***
 Purpose
   

  

 The European Innovation Council (EIC) Fund is the equity investment arm of the EIC programme with a mandate to invest between EUR 1-10m in equity to selected European start-ups in the Deep tech space. The current portfolio of companies managed in the EIC Fund consists of approximately 300 companies and is expected to grow to 500-600 companies over the following years, making it one of the largest Deep tech VC Funds in Europe. EIB acts as the investment adviser to the EIC Fund.
   

  

 As (Associate) Portfolio Monitoring Officer, you will carry out regular and ad hoc monitoring, reporting and analytics activities of the EIC Fund investment portfolio.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 The successful candidate will report to the Head of EIC Operational & Business Support Unit (OBS) and cooperate closely with the other team members in the EIC Investment Services Division.
   

  

 Considering that the EIC Fund was only set-up formally in 2022, many of the procedures, processes and systems for portfolio management and reporting are still under development, allowing for the successful candidate to contribute to the development of state-of-the-art processes.
   

  

**You Will Be Responsible For**
* Carrying out and producing analytics of the EICF Fund equity investment portfolio
* Supporting in carrying out regular portfolio valuations
* Creating internal procedures and processes for portfolio monitoring and reporting and support in the implementation of relevant systems and tools,
* Providing support in collecting periodic and ad hoc monitoring reports from investee companies,
* Other activities in view of operational needs and creating efficient and scalable processes and procedures for the portfolio monitoring, reporting and management of the EIC Fund portfolio.


 Accountabilities
   

  

* Take responsibility, liaising closely with the HoU, HoD and other members in in the Division, in developing efficient, scalable and accurate portfolio monitoring and reporting procedures. Create action plans for implementation and coordinate the implementation of such procedures and processes.
* Take responsibility in coordinating, liaising closely with external valuators, bi-annual valuations of the transaction portfolio and prepare valuation and portfolio performance reports as requested by external stakeholders
* Support the implementation of relevant transaction and portfolio management systems in the EIC Fund. Ensure adherence to data governance standards, including data integrity, completeness, and consistency across systems.
* Participate in defining, refining, and updating KPIs used for portfolio performance monitoring and risk assessment.
* Produce ad hoc and periodic operational, policy and/or financial analytics reports as may be required. Prepare presentations and present the results internally and to relevant EIC Fund stakeholders whenever requested.
* Monitor the developments in the underlying transaction portfolio and flag potential risks and issues based on pre-agreed KPIs. Conduct ad-hoc reviews in response to macroeconomic or market events.
* Prepare portfolio updates and insights as may be requested for instance on thematic industry areas and/or company characteristics, to investment decisions, exit readiness valuations and much more.
* Carry out any ad-hoc information request and/or potential horizontal task assigned by the management.
* Draft technical specifications for new automated reports. Work closely with IT and data teams to test new reporting features and validate data accuracy. Identify gaps in existing portfolio tools and propose improvements or integrations (e.g., dashboard upgrades, linking valuation logic with reporting tools).
* Take part in implementing a data-driven approach within the EIC Fund building sustainable, automated systems and processes capable of efficiently handling a rapidly growing portfolio.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Business Analytics, Business Engineering, and ideally supplemented by postgraduate studies, and/or relevant training in financial sector analysis, data analytics or management.
* A minimum of 3 years of relevant professional experience including in venture capital, private equity finance, fund management or in an investment fund environment.
* Knowledge of the venture capital industry (investment or fund related).
* Excellent knowledge of the standard MS Office (Excel, Word, Powerpoint, Outlook, PowerAutomate).
* Solid experience in data management, handling (relational) databases, data analytics and data visualization.
* Experience in portfolio management and portfolio management and reporting tools (e.g. Vestberry) would be a strong advantage.
* Knowledge of SQL, working with Data Warehouses and/or data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau) is considered an advantage.
* Interest and/or experience in European venture capital and passion towards supporting innovative European start-ups.
* Knowledge of the EIB's mission and activities.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications: 7
 **th November 2025**

title: Android/iOS Engineer - Automation and GenAI
description:
Join our Client Platform studio and help shape the future of developer experience by building automation and GenAI solutions for Android and iOS platforms. You’ll work with a passionate team focused on making our tools smarter and easier to use - while driving the next wave of innovation in mobile development. If you’re excited about transforming how client engineers build, this is the place to be.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Collaborate with engineers and product managers to design, build, and optimize infrastructure that leverages automation and Generative AI for Android or iOS.
* Lead hands-on experiments, rapidly testing hypotheses to improve how client engineers work.
* Drive the adoption of GenAI and machine learning in our development workflows, and help shape build vs. buy strategies for new solutions.
* Mentor team members, encourage best practices, and foster a culture of learning and innovation around GenAI.
* Stay plugged into industry trends and share GenAI insights and opportunities across teams at Spotify.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You know how to build and maintain high-quality Android or iOS apps, and care deeply about developer experience.
* You are experienced with machine learning frameworks, automation tools, and GenAI technologies.
* You have a deep understanding of platform and infrastructure development challenges on mobile.
* You care about fast, hypothesis-driven experimentation and continuous improvement.
* You have strong communication skills and enjoy collaborating across teams.
* (Bonus) You have experience with data pipelines and instrumentation.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in-person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
**About Tzeract**
 Tzeract is changing the way we bet on sports. As Kambi’s in-house startup, we've built a completely new platform from the ground up - with our own AI at the core, not just as an add-on. Today we already handle over 500 millions bets in distributed systems with a low latency, and your work will be scaled globally from day one.
   

  

 We iterate quickly, decide fast, and your calendar stays free for the work that matters. This gives you time for coffee breaks, test ideas and solve problems together. In this role, you’ll help shape both the product and parts of the architecture. It’s the combination of startup freedom with an enterprise touch - and your contributions will be visible and felt by millions of users worldwide.
   

  

**What's our current focus?** 
 Well, exploring new sports markets. For you as a developer, that means diving into the rules of the game and turning them into code - building the odds infrastructure, creating models that run in real time. It's a fun and collaborative playground with a clear goal: creating the next generation of how sports, data, and AI come together - built from scratch, with impact at its core.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 This is not your usual software engineering role. At Tzeract, you'll be the bridge between software engineers and quant engineers - ensuring the models we build are optimized and able to be deployed to our cloud infrastructure. It's therefore a strong merit to find mathematical challenges exciting, since it will play a part of your daily work.
   

  

 You'll collaborate in small teams of engineers (+20 people) with expertise in quantitative analysis, data, and AI. Together, you’ll develop systems that analyze real-time data, delivering personalized experiences to sports fans everywhere.
   

  

 Tzeract is a fast-paced startup, where scope or roadmap can shift to align with future goals. If this excites you, along with a hybrid work setup and a central office location, we’d love to get to know you better.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable microservices using Python & AWS technologies.
* Implement best practices in SWE, including CI/CD, containerization, and automated testing to ensure quality and speed of deployment.
* Collaborate with software and quant engineers - as well as scientists to integrate AI models and algorithms into production systems efficiently.
* Contribute to improvements on both technical and operational aspects of our daily work.


**What we believe you have:**
* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or a related field (a PhD in Mathematics is a plus).
* Solid experience in Python and/or experience with low-level languages (C++ is a plus).
* 5+ years of software development experience or similar, with the ability to quickly adapt to new technologies.
* Experience with modern DevOps tools and practices, including Docker, Jenkins, or similar.
* Great communicator, able to own your projects and gather colleagues when needed to solve complex problems.


**Note** 
 . We will only be able to consider candidates living in Sweden for this position.
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: Ekonomiskt råd - arbeta med tullfrågor i Bryssel
description:
**EU-representationen i Bryssel, Finansdepartementet**
 Är du intresserad av att arbeta i hjärtat av EU, att vara med och förhandla tullfrågor och representera Sverige inom EU? Finansdepartementet söker nu ett ekonomiskt råd till representationen i Bryssel. Som ekonomiskt råd får du ett mycket variationsrikt arbete i en spännande och internationell miljö.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Till finanssektionen på Sveriges ständiga representation vid Europeiska unionen i Bryssel söker nu skatte- och tullavdelningen en attaché som ska arbeta med tullfrågor kopplade till tullunionen, tullagstiftningen, Världstullorganisationen samt brottsbekämpning. Arbetsuppgifterna innebär att följa, bevaka, analysera och rapportera utvecklingen inom tullområdet samt i övrigt aktivt biträda i departementets EU-arbete på skatte- och tullområdet såväl i rådet som i andra internationella forum såsom t.ex. Världstullorganisationen. Arbetet kommer att ske i nära samarbete med medarbetare på skatte- och tullavdelningen på Finansdepartementet, men även med medarbetare på andra avdelningar och departement.
   

  

 Du kommer att företräda Sverige i EU-arbetet och fungera som en länk mellan Regeringskansliet och Bryssel inom ditt ansvarsområde. Arbetet ställer höga krav på flexibilitet och innebär frekventa kontakter med företrädare för andra medlemsstater och EU:s institutioner. Att ge information och stöd till regeringens företrädare samt tjänstemän utgör också en stor del av arbetsuppgifterna. Arbetet sker i nära kontakt och samarbete med övriga attachéer på finanssektionen samt rättsråd och kan även innebära att du täcker upp för eller stöttar kollegor på finanssektionen.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Vi söker dig som har en akademisk examen, gärna med inriktning på juridik, ekonomi eller samhällskunskap alternativt en likvärdig utbildning som erhållits på annat sätt. För att passa i rollen behöver du ha goda kunskaper om EU:s institutioner och beslutsprocesser och erfarenhet av Regeringskansliets arbetsrutiner och processer. Du behöver även ha erfarenhet av att arbeta med tullfrågor eller ett annat för tjänsten relevant verksamhetsområde.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har arbetat i Regeringskansliet och har erfarenhet av förhandlingsarbete på EU nivå eller internationell nivå. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av tullagstiftning och frågor kopplade till tullunionen. Det är även meriterande om du har kännedom om internationellt brottsbekämpande arbete och erfarenhet av handelsrelaterade frågor. Du har mycket goda språkkunskaper, särskilt i engelska. Kunskaper i franska eller något annat av EU:s övriga arbetsspråk är meriterande.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 Regeringskansliets medarbetarkriterier är helhet, utveckling, resultat. Alla som arbetar i Regeringskansliet behöver ha helhetssyn och samarbeta för verksamhetens bästa. Du förväntas bidra med ditt perspektiv och din kompetens samt vara öppen för andras. Du kommer med idéer och nya angreppssätt för att förbättra och utveckla verksamheten och din egen kompetens. Du är inriktad på resultat i ditt agerande och anpassar dig när behov och inriktning ändras.
   

  

 I den här tjänsten bör du dessutom vara utåtriktad som person och ha en god förmåga och intresse av att knyta goda och förtroendefulla relationer med representanter från andra medlemsstater och EU-institutionerna. Du behöver kunna arbeta självständigt med stor flexibilitet i en internationell miljö, tidvis under stor tidspress. Du kan analysera och strukturera stora mängder information. Uppgifterna kräver också att du är resultatinriktad, omdömesgill, noggrann och har lätt för att uttrycka dig i både tal och skrift. Du behöver även vara lyhörd med förmåga att hitta kompromisser.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tjänsten är ett vikariat på sju månader med beräknat startdatum den 1 mars 2026.
   

  

 Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Du måste vara svensk medborgare, men får gärna ha utländsk bakgrund.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?** 
 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta Charlotta Carlberg som är enhetschef, på 08-405 28 74. Du är också välkommen att kontakta HR-handläggare Catrine Thudén på 08-405 38 67. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Miriam Ben Hadji Ali för Saco och Lotta Nordqvist för ST. Du når dem via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg
 **senast den 2 november 2025.**
 Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Finansdepartementet ansvarar för frågor som rör statens ekonomi. Det handlar om samordning av statens budget, prognoser och analyser, skattefrågor samt styrning och förvaltning av statens verksamhet. Dessutom ansvarar departementet för frågor som rör finansmarknad, kommuner och regioner, upphandling, bolag med statligt ägande, digitalisering och it samt konsumentlagstiftning.

title: Data Engineer till BROCC
description:
**Är du den vi söker?** 




 Vill du vara med och utveckla en dataplattform som verkligen gör skillnad? Som Data Engineer hos BROCC får du en nyckelroll i att bygga och utveckla den infrastruktur som gör det möjligt för hela organisationen att arbeta datadrivet, från dagliga analyser till strategiska beslut.
 



  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 I rollen som Data Engineer kombinerar du teknik, struktur och förståelse för affären och blir en central del i att driva vår dataplattform framåt. Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden omfattar bland annat att:
 



  





 • Designa, implementera och underhålla datapipelines och ETL-processer i Snowflake.
 



 • Arbeta med dbt eller Meltano för att utveckla och dokumentera tydliga och effektiva datatransformationer.
 



 • Säkerställa hög datakvalitet, spårbarhet och tillförlitlighet genom validering, övervakning och dokumentation.
 



 • Bidra till att bygga en skalbar och robust dataplattform som stödjer både nuvarande och framtida behov.
 



 • Samarbeta med verksamheten för att förstå databehov och översätta dem till hållbara tekniska lösningar som driver affären framåt.
 



 • Identifiera och implementera förbättringar som ökar automatisering, effektivitet och prestanda i våra dataprocesser.
 



  





 Du blir en del av ett team på tre personer och kommer att spela en viktig roll i att vidareutveckla vår datamiljö. Genom att bygga stabila och väldokumenterade datalösningar lägger du grunden för tillförlitlig analys, rapportering och innovation. Vår datastack består av Snowflake, Meltano, dbt, Airflow, Fivetran, AWS och Kubernetes.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som vill vara med och forma hur BROCC arbetar med data, en tekniskt kunnig och analytiskt lagd person som trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och affär. Du har en akademisk bakgrund inom exempelvis systemvetenskap, data/IT eller motsvarande område, samt flerårig erfarenhet av arbete inom datateknik, data engineering eller BI-utveckling. Du har mycket goda kunskaper i SQL, erfarenhet av dimensionell och relationell datamodellering och är van vid att bygga och optimera datapipelines i molnbaserade miljöer. Du har arbetat praktiskt med moderna datalager som Snowflake och har förståelse för hur man skapar en skalbar, säker och effektiv dataplattform.
 



  





 Du är en person som trivs i nära samarbete med andra och har lätt för att omvandla verksamhetens behov till tekniska lösningar. Samtidigt kan du förklara komplexa datakoncept på ett sätt som är begripligt även för icke-tekniska målgrupper. Erfarenhet av dbt eller Meltano för datatransformationer samt orkestreringsverktyg som Airflow är starkt meriterande. Har du dessutom förståelse för regelefterlevnad och regulatoriska rapporteringskrav inom finansiella tjänster är det mycket positivt.
 



  





 För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är nyfiken, engagerad och lösningsorienterad. Du brinner för teknik och data, gillar att ta ansvar och vill ständigt utvecklas tillsammans med ditt team. Du arbetar strukturerat och noggrant, ser både helheten och detaljerna, och har kvalitet som ledstjärna. Samtidigt är du en lagspelare som trivs i samarbete med andra. Du är kommunikativ, lyhörd och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap för att lyfta både teamet och verksamheten som helhet. Du har god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska. Företagsspråket är engelska, vilket innebär att dokumentation och presentationer sker på engelska.
 



  





**Om BROCC** 




 Hos BROCC får du inte bara en spännande roll, du får också möjlighet att göra verklig skillnad. Vi är ett innovativt fintechbolag som kombinerar teknik, data och affär för att skapa rättvisa och värdeskapande finansiella tjänster. Sedan starten 2016 har vi utmanat branschen med vår vision om att bygga en modern, transparent och kundcentrerad finansiell plattform. Genom förvärv av GCC Capital AB (nu Brocc Finance AB) och Chassi Group med bolagen HandlarFinans och AMCAP, har vi växt till en stark koncern med ett brett erbjudande inom in- och utlåning, försäkring och objektfinansiering i Sverige och Finland. Vi står under Finansinspektionens tillsyn, och våra bolag omfattas av den statliga insättningsgarantin, något som ger våra kunder trygghet och våra medarbetare en stabil grund att bygga vidare på.
 



  





 Hos oss får du arbeta i en modern och tekniskt avancerad miljö, där innovation och affärsutveckling går hand i hand. Vi sitter i fina lokaler mitt i centrala Stockholm. Låter det intressant? Läs gärna mer på www.brocc.se
 



  





**Ansök enkelt med ditt CV** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Inhouse IT & Tech. Tjänsten är en tillsvidaretjänst på heltid med placering på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm. Vi tar inte emot några ansökningar via mejl, utan du söker enkelt tjänsten via www.inhouse.se. Ansök redan idag då urval sker löpande! Har du några funderingar så är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Louise Hagen Furugård, louise.furugard@inhouse.se, 0733118726
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Partnerships Manager
description:
**Job description** 




 As Sites & Partners Manager Recharge, your primary responsibility will be to manage and develop partnerships with new and existing location partners, with the ultimate goal of increasing the amount of energy sold at our charging stations.
 



  





 This role involves identifying, qualifying, and processing new leads for potential partners, as well as maintaining and strengthening relationships with existing partners. You will engage in negotiations, presentations, contract discussions, and performance monitoring. You will collaborate with a diverse range of partners, including local property owners, restaurants, municipalities, and multinational real estate owners.
 



  





 This is an exciting segment to work within, where the business model focuses on mutual benefit and cooperation agreements that benefit both parties. You will also contribute to strategic decision-making, product development, and business improvements across the company, having the partner perspective in mind.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 



* Manage and develop partner relationships
* Network performance monitoring & reporting
* Site evaluation
* Contract management
* Identify new business opportunities
* Coordination with internal stakeholders



  





**Success factors** 




 You are passionate and result-oriented, dedicated to creating long-term relationships with partners. As an excellent communicator, you have the ability to listen and understand the needs of different stakeholders. With a strong drive and proactive attitude, you take initiative and identify opportunities. You are reliable and willing to tackle various tasks as needed. You are a team player who enjoys collaborating and contributing to a positive work environment. Flexibility and the ability to adapt to changing circumstances are part of your strengths.
 



  




* Educational background, such as a BSc/BA in business administration, sales, economics or a relevant field.
* Proven experience in partner and/or key account management.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for building relationships at all organizational levels.
* Capability to manage multiple client accounts.
* Experience in contract negotiations including basic legal competence.
* Advanced language skills in Swedish and English.
* Proactive, accurate, organized, and reliable
* Self-motivated, responsible, and independent.
* Capability to work independently yet collaboratively (teamwork).
* Analytical mindset and skills in MS Excel/PowerBi/SalesForce
* Driver’s license.



  





 We believe that the right candidate has a genuine interest in the green shift and is either already driving an EV or is very interested in doing so in the near future.
 



  





**What can we offer?** 




 We offer you a role within a team advancing sustainable transportation and creating a greener future. Your work will have a direct impact on shaping the electric vehicle future. Our core values are Care, Share and Dare where we focus on building a better future in a rapidly growing business, together.
 



  




* Subsidized EV charging
* Flexible working hours
* Development and career opportunities
* An inclusive working environment within a Nordic company
* Good pension and insurance schemes
* Modern and central location in Stockholm



  





**Interested?** 




 Do you want to start an exciting and meaningful journey with Recharge and have a lot of fun on the way? Please apply before November 1. Interviews will be conducted coninuously and the position may be filled before end of application period.
 



 Recharge values diversity. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
 



  





**Place of work:** 
 at our office in central Stockholm. Some traveling will be required, primarily within the Nordic region. This role reports to the Head of Sites & Partners Sweden.
 



  





**Application deadline:** 
 Please apply no later than 01-11-2025. Position open until filled. Please apply by uploading your CV and application letter through our recruitment system Nuu.
 



 Questions about the position can be directed to: Bertil Abrahamsson, Head of Sites & Partners Sweden: Bertil.Abrahamsson@rechargeinfra.com or through our recruitment system Nuu.
 



  





*We do background checks on relevant candidate via our partner Semac AS.*

title: Sr Revenue Operations Analyst
description:
**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 EMEA Revenue Operations team in Sinch is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will require a strong foundation in Salesforce, Excel, Tableau, Power BI as well as other advanced reporting tools, coupled with prior management consulting experience to drive data-driven insights, stakeholder engagement, and strategic decision-making across the EMEA region. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable intelligence to support business growth and efficiency for the region.
 



**In this role you'll make a significant impact by driving the activities in the following areas:** 




**Data Analysis & Reporting** 



* Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets from Salesforce, Excel, Tableau and other platforms.
* Develop interactive dashboards and visualizations in Excel, Tableau and Salesforce.
* Deliver regular and ad-hoc reports to senior management and business stakeholders.



**Business Insights & Strategy** 



* Translate complex data findings into clear business recommendations.
* Identify trends, opportunities, and risks to support regional business objectives.
* Partner with cross-functional teams to optimize processes and improve performance.



**Stakeholder Engagement & Consulting** 



* Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders across the EMEA region.
* Leverage consulting experience to manage expectations, challenge assumptions, and align on data-driven decisions.
* Gather and translate business requirements into actionable data needs, collaborating closely with data engineering teams to design models and enable effective reporting and BI solutions.



**Data Governance & Best Practices** 



* Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with company standards.
* Promote data-driven decision-making across the organization.
* Drive adoption of dashboards and reporting tools within business teams.







**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:** 



* Maintain and optimize Tableau, Excel, Salesforce reports and dashboards for business needs.
* Design and automate Excel-based models for recurring analysis.
* Build advanced Tableau, Salesforce dashboards to support leadership decision-making.
* Provide performance metrics, KPIs, and business health reporting for EMEA.
* Partner with Sales, Finance, Marketing, Product and Operations teams on cross-regional projects.
* Support strategic initiatives by providing scenario modeling and forecasting.
* Deliver clear documentation and training for stakeholders using analytics tools.







**REQUIREMENTS** 




**Professional Experience** 



* 5-7 years in data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics consulting.
* Minimum of 2 years in management consulting or a similar advisory role.
* Strong focus on accuracy, detail, and precision.



**Technical Skills** 



* Advanced Salesforce reporting and data extraction.
* Proficiency in Excel (advanced formulas, pivot tables; macros preferred).
* Expertise in Tableau, Looker, and other visualization tools.
* Nice-to-have: experience with data warehouses (Snowflake) and data build tools (DBT).
* Ability to interpret complex datasets and transform them into actionable insights.



**Stakeholder & Communication Skills** 



* Proven ability to influence, collaborate, and communicate effectively with senior stakeholders.
* Skilled at presenting data in a clear and compelling way.



**Education & Languages** 



* Degree in Business, Economics, Data Analytics, or related field.
* English fluency required; additional EMEA languages are an advantage.







 Our corporate language is English,
 **please submit your application in English** 
 .
 



 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation outside the EU at this time. Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.







**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Business Controller
description:
At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company.
 



  





 Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



  





**About the role:** 




  





 We are now looking for a high-impact Business Controller to join our controlling team and support this journey by providing strategic financial insights into our operations and supply chain activities. This role is based at our headquarters in central Stockholm and reports directly to the Head of Business Control.
 



  





**Main responsibilities:** 




  




* Act as a business partner to the Operations, Supply Chain, and Sourcing teams, driving performance through financial insights and decision support
* Lead cost tracking and variance analysis in production and materials to identify efficiency gains and reduce waste
* Contribute to the Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process with financial scenario modeling and capacity insights
* Develop and follow up on KPIs related to manufacturing, inventory, and procurement
* Own the forecasting and budgeting processes within your scope, including our German-based subsidiary, identifying bottlenecks and supporting global process improvements
* Collaborate across regions to harmonize and strengthen group supply chain performance



  





**Desired profile:** 




  




* 5+ years of experience in business controlling and/or management consulting, preferably with exposure to supply chain, manufacturing, or logistics
* Degree in finance, business administration, accounting, or a related field
* Strong analytical skills and advanced Excel proficiency (Power Query is a plus); experience with BI tools is highly valued
* Confident communicator with the ability to translate financial data into actionable insights across all levels of the organization
* Professional fluency in English (Swedish is a plus)
* Experience from project-based or matrix organizations is a merit



  





**How to apply:** 




 Apply with your CV. For questions about the role or Tobii Dynavox, please contact Mikael Schmidt at Fand Recruitment (mikael.schmidt@fand.se).
 



  





**Why join Dynavox Group?** 




  





 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




  





 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
 



  





**• Purpose-Driven Work:** 
 Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
 



**• “Yes, and...” Flexibility:** 
 Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options, so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
 



**• Growth and Development:** 
 Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
 



**• Inclusive and Supportive Culture:** 
 Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
 



**• A Global Leader with Heart** 
 : Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Manager, Business Development (Maternity Cover 14 months)
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
****Title And Summary****
 Manager, Business Development (Maternity Cover 14 months)
   

  

**Overview**
* Implement and deliver on sales strategies as it relates to merchants across the Northern Europe division and achieving sales goals that focuses on growing Mastercard’s share of payments, market acceptance & the number of customer touch points
* Manages existing merchant customer relationships and works to identify opportunities and customer needs which can then be applied and executed upon.
* Partners with customers to identify solutions that meet market requirements
* Identify business opportunities, shortlist and select qualified prospects propose appropriate merchant solutions.


* Delivers against sales and net revenue targets
* Deep knowledge of the payment & acceptance eco-system
* Identify strategies, solutions and proposals for merchant customers across the relevant sectors
* Manages merchant relationships that are strategically important to the market
* Sell & implement value added solutions to merchants (tokenization, authentication, data & services)
* Develops and implements sales plans including business development, marketing and product management at both customer level & pan-sector level
* Partners with the customer to establish, execute and report progress against annual business plans
* Plays a lead role in internal conversations with key decision makers to bring new or emerging products to implementation stage in market
* Negotiates and executes on the customer agreement process
* Identifies & recommends products to enhance a customer/ sector profitability & consumer experience
* Possess the ability to network very well, to be able to expand your contact network within a customer’s structure & understand how to engage appropriately at all levels


 Experiences
   

  

* In depth experience executing and managing sales strategies for numerous complex or large accounts/ industry verticals.
* Ability to translate technical product specification into sales messages for prospects
* Understanding of the main drivers affecting the industry and the ability to articulate these in detail, in particular how they correlate to certain merchant sectors
* Passionate for developing customer-centric solutions and a proven experience in developing relationships and building sustainable partnerships
* Collaborative with proven track record of building momentum with internal and external partners.
* Good interpersonal and communication skills including both oral and written
* Strong customer orientation and successful negotiation skills
* Ability to build excellent relationships both internally and externally
* Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines


 Please note: This position is a Maternity Cover role. We are looking for someone who can join us from January 2026 through the end of February 2027.
   

  

**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And, Therefore, It Is Expected That Every Person Working For, Or On Behalf Of, Mastercard Is Responsible For Information Security And Must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Internship Sales (Quotation Management)
description:
**About Signify**
 We are Signify, the new company name of Philips Lighting, and we light up the world!
   

  

 Through bold discovery and cutting-edge innovation, we lead an industry that is vital for the future of our planet: lighting. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we're breaking new ground in data analytics, AI, and smart solutions for homes, offices, cities, and beyond.
   

  

 At Signify, you can shape tomorrow by building on our incredible 125+ year legacy while working toward even bolder sustainability goals. Our culture of continuous learning, creativity, and commitment to diversity and inclusion empowers you to grow your skills and career.
   

  

 Join us, and together, we’ll transform our industry, making a lasting difference for brighter lives and a better world. You light the way.
   

  

 More about the role
   

  

 There’s a certain kind of energy here. You can feel it. It’s what happens when your internship creates real impact!
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **student worker to support our quotation team in Sweden** 
 . In this role, you’ll ensure quotation requests are delivered with accuracy and speed, analyze and maintain price requests, and create meaningful solutions for our customers while streamlining internal processes.
   

  

 This is the internship you’ve been waiting for! Ready for the great leap?
   

  

**Start:** 
 As soon as possible
   

  

**Duration:** 
 1 year, full-time
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Calculate prices based on input from the marketing and sales team
* Monitor the quotation mailbox and distribute requests within the team
* Make multiple calculations according to customer agreements
* Provide standard prices when no specific quotation is needed


 More about you
   

  

 While we value and appreciate all applicants, we believe that the following skills will help you shine in this role:
   

  

* Experience in working with Excel
* Ability to understand complex set-ups, “see the whole picture,” and assess impacts of decisions
* Comfortable working with deadlines
* A sense of humor
* Fluent Swedish language skills


**Everything we’ll do for you**
 You can grow a lasting career here. We’ll encourage you, support you, and challenge you. We’ll help you learn and progress in a way that’s right for you, with coaching and mentoring along the way. We’ll listen to you too, because we see and value every one of our 30,000+ people.
   

  

 We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace fosters creativity, innovation, and a full spectrum of bright ideas. With a global workforce representing 99 nationalities, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment where every voice is heard and valued, helping us all achieve more together.
   

  

 Come join us, and together we can light the way.
   

  

****Our process****
 Join us in transforming our industry and making a positive impact on the environment and society. Apply now to become a part of our positive, high-energy team at Signify. We kindly ask you to apply through our Signify career site. After a pre-selection process based on your CV, you will be invited for a video interview and after successful review, a business interview.

title: GRC (Governance, Risk & Compliance) Lead
description:
**Welcome to Eficode!**
 We are building the future of software development - specialising in AI, Cyber Security, Cloud, DevOps, Agile, and Enterprise Service Management. We’re passionate about sharing our knowledge—not just within our teams, but with the community around us as well. We invest heavily in our people, whether through conferences, training, or other growth opportunities. For our clients, we don't want to be just another cog in the machine; we aim to be the trusted evangelists who show what good truly looks like.
   

  

 Ready to lead a modern GRC practice? We go beyond traditional GRC, integrating solutions into our clients’ existing IT to create sustainable value. If you're a commercial leader, this is your chance to lead our team, drive sales, and shape the future of GRC.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for an experienced and commercially driven leader and consultant to take full leadership responsibility for our Governance, Risk & Compliance team in Stockholm.
   

  

 The role requires a combination of strong expertise in governance, risk management, and compliance with the ability to drive business through networking, relationship building, and sales activities. The main objective is to secure a stable, profitable, and relevant project portfolio while further growing and developing the team both commercially and professionally.
   

  

 You will also collaborate with other teams across Eficode, building expertise that links to the rest of the company.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Will Include**
* Leading and developing the GRC team.
* Building and expanding client relationships, primarily within the financial sector and related industries.
* Driving the entire sales process, from identifying opportunities to signing contracts.
* Ensuring profitable growth and effective resource utilization in the team.
* Developing and executing strategies to position Eficode as a leading GRC player in Sweden.
* Serving as a strong professional and commercial ambassador for the firm.


**Who We Are Looking For**
 The ideal candidate will be a proactive, outgoing, and results-oriented professional with a strong personal brand. You will be an expert in combining sales, delivery, and leadership to achieve business targets.
   

  

* Approximately 10+ years of experience as a consultant or leader in governance, risk, and compliance, preferably in the financial sector
* Proven commercial acumen with the ability to build and grow a client portfolio
* Strategic and hands-on – able to combine sales, delivery, and leadership
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and develop people
* Results-oriented with a clear understanding of balancing quality, delivery, and profitability
* Relevant academic background, preferably at Master’s level
* Full working proficiency in Swedish (due to customer interactions often being expected to be handled in Swedish)


**Why Eficode?**
* Impact: This is a unique opportunity to build and lead a strong cyber security practice from the ground up, in a growing organization.
* Join a team of bright minds: At Eficode, you will be part of a community of passionate professionals who are dedicated to delivering value and finding the right solutions for our customers.
* Enjoy flexibility and freedom: We offer flexible and hybrid work opportunities, so you can shape your work in a way that fits you best. While there are no set days, you will be expected to meet clients and be active in the market.
* Invest in your growth: We are committed to supporting your development with our own Efi Academy, internal training, and a mentoring program.
* Attractive compensation and benefits: We offer an attractive package of benefits, from medical insurance to social events.


**Ready to build with us?**
 If you're looking forward to building and leading your team to success, we encourage you to apply by submitting your CV, highlighting the projects and the industries you’ve worked on. Please note this is a local position
 **based in the Stockholm region** 
 .
   

  

**Diversity & Inclusion**
*At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants.*
*We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognize that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds and cultures we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.*
*To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information and your picture on your job application.*
**Salary Statement**
*At Eficode, we believe your compensation should reflect the impact you make and how you grow along the way. Your salary develops through regular check-ins with your team lead, where we look at things like your skills, experience, client work, feedback, and overall contribution — both to your projects and to our culture. As a consultancy, it’s natural that factors like time spent on billable client work are part of the picture — but so are your development, collaboration, and everyday efforts that drive value. We also carry out a company-wide salary review once a year.*
*On top of your salary, we offer a broad mix of benefits, both financial and non-financial, to support your well-being, work-life balance, and professional growth.*
**Find Out More About Our Benefits Here.**
*Eficode, better made possible.*

title: Analytiker antibedrägeri
description:
Till sektionen Antibedrägeri och Utredning söker vi nu en Analytiker antibedrägeri. Sektionen är nyinrättad under året och tar ett helhetsansvar för antibedrägeri (förebygga, identifiera, utreda) inom Folksams sakförsäkringsverksamhet. I denna roll ges möjligheten att vara med att ta Folksams förmåga inom antibedrägeri till nästa nivå. Här får du ett unikt tillfälle till att komma in i en tidig fas efter denna sektions uppstart och att vara med och fortsatt bygga upp denna verksamhet. Du bidrar till att skapa en tryggare och mer ekonomiskt fördelaktig framtid för bolagets 4 miljoner kunder – i den här rollen kan du göra skillnad varje dag!
 



  





 För dig som söker en arbetsplats som präglas av professionalism, ett stort engagemang och en verkligt god kollegial stämning, är Folksam helt rätt som bolag!
 



  





**Är detta din nya utmaning?** 




 Rollen som Analytiker antibedrägeri är, liksom sektionen Antibedrägeri och Utredning, nyinrättad för i år och är en del av en större satsning på att stärka antibedrägeriförmågan på Folksam. Sektionen tillhör enheten Skador som ansvarar för hantering av samtliga försäkringsrelaterade skadeärenden, vilket 2023 var över 1,1 miljoner ärenden. Sektionen har flera ben, såsom strategi, analys, och utredning. Inledningsvis består sektionen av cirka 30 medarbetare.
 



  





 Ditt uppdrag som analytiker är att designa och underhålla modeller för att analysera bedrägerier med syfte att motverka och identifiera sådana. Du arbetar nära affärsutvecklare, utredare och övriga analysfunktioner inom Skador. Du förser verksamheten med relevanta analyser och insikter. Du kommer ges möjlighet att sätta stor egen prägel på utformningen av rollen. Här ges du en unik möjlighet till att med din utforskande och kreativa kapacitet bidra på en spännande och för bolaget viktig utvecklingsresa. Du får chansen att tillsammans med dina kollegor bidra till något större – något med verklig betydelse. Du blir en del av ett dynamiskt samarbete där många perspektiv möts och skapar värde.
 



  





 Du rapporterar till sektionschefen för Antibedrägeri och Utredning och kommer att ha kontaktytor mot många olika delar av Folksamgruppen. Föredragen placeringsort är Stockholm, men placering på något av Folksams andra kontor kan vara möjligt.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 



* Utveckla och förfina modeller och analysregler kopplat till bedrägerier.
* Medverka till att det finns tillräckliga data och integrationer för bedrägerianalys.
* Stötta utveckling och införande av nya verktyg inom antibedrägeri.
* Analysera och identifiera mönster och trender kopplat till bedrägerier.



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har relevant högskoleutbildning inom till exempel statistik, matematik eller data. Alternativt har du motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet. Du har några års erfarenhet av analys och datamodellering och erfarenhet av att använda SQL, SAS, Databricks och/eller Python som analysverktyg. Du har erfarenhet av att driva eller delta i projekt relaterade till IT- och teknikimplementering. Tidigare erfarenhet av bedrägeriarbete är meriterande, gärna inom sakförsäkring. Du behärskar de svenska och engelska språken flytande i tal och skrift.
 



  





 Som person är du analytisk lagd med en förmåga att hantera komplexa problem. Du tar gärna initiativ, arbetar effektivt och har en vilja att nå framdrift. Du är nyfiken på att förstå affärens och mottagarnas behov och utvecklar därefter datadrivna lösningar som gör skillnad i verksamheten. Du är kommunikativ och trivs med att aktivt arbeta för ett bra samarbete med personer runtom i organisationen, i syfte att tillsammans uppnå bästa möjliga resultat.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Folksam med Prodiem. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, varför vi gärna vill ha din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Ansökan sker via Prodiems hemsida
 
 www.prodiem.se
 
 . Vid frågor kontaktar du Jessica Maurell på Prodiem, tfn 073-233 01 17 eller Caroline Björk på tfn, 073-303 34 66.
 



  





 Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Ann-Louise Andersson 070-831 61 44, Forena Mats Kjellgren 070-831 59 98 och Handels Mikael A Carlsson 070-831 51 32.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





*Kundägda Folksamgruppen erbjuder sedan 1908 försäkringar och sparande som ger trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi gör det enklare för våra fyra miljoner kunder att känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld genom rätt försäkringar, rätt sparande och rätt hjälp när något händer.* 




*Läs mer om företaget på
 
 https://www.folksam.se*

title: Campaign Management Team Lead (m/f/d) - FinTech
description:
Everyone's story matters. Come shape your story with us at Riverty.
   

  

**But where does that take you?**
 To one of our 30 hybrid workspaces – designed for exchanging ideas, learning from others, and shaping the way we work. An international community of over 4,000 people, representing almost 80 nationalities across 11 countries. United by one mission: Combining empathy, advanced technology and data-driven insights to keep people and businesses in flow. With payments made for them. So that they don't have to worry about it.
   

  

**And there's more:** 
 We are part of the family-owned Bertelsmann group. Established. Corporate. In a fast-paced industry. We enable flexible payments in various industries, simplifying the financial management of known brands and helping people repay debt to build financial confidence. In short: shaping FinTech.
   

  

**We are looking for a**
**Campaign Management Lead (m/f/d)**
**(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at one of our locations in Berlin, Verl or Stockholm – flexible working conditions available**
 At Riverty, we’re redefining how people and businesses interact with financial services across Europe. As our Campaign Management Lead (m/f/d), you will lead a new, cross-functional team at the intersection of data, creativity, and business growth. You'll be responsible for orchestrating full-funnel, insight-driven marketing initiatives for both consumers (B2C) and merchants (B2B) — driving measurable impact across all growth channels.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Lead, coach, and inspire a team of 10 experts in growth marketing, UX, reporting, and market research.
* Foster a high-performance culture focused on ownership, speed, and learning.
* Own the development and execution of full-funnel, international marketing campaigns for B2B and B2C.
* Optimize account-based and platform-based marketing processes to drive high-quality leads and revenue growth.
* Champion audience insights and persona development to inform campaign messaging and targeting.
* Define and monitor marketing KPIs, ensuring campaign efficiency, lead quality, and strong ROI.
* Drive UX and reporting excellence to ensure campaigns meet experience, legal, and brand standards.
* Collaborate closely with Product, Commercial, Legal, and Country Leads to ensure market fit and delivery success.


**Your Profile**
* Proven experience in leading data-driven marketing teams, with a focus on strategic campaign execution across B2B and B2C.
* Demonstrated success in account-based marketing and full-funnel campaigns that deliver measurable business results.
* Strong leadership track record in managing cross-functional, international teams.
* Analytical mindset with fluency in KPIs, marketing performance metrics, and campaign automation.
* Experience in fintech, financial services, or other regulated industries is a strong plus.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills; fluent in English, German is a plus.
* A “can-do” attitude, with the ability to prioritize what truly matters, and the ambition to continuously learn and evolve.


 #EUR35
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
   

  

 We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Architect-Sols Archt
description:
When you join Verizon
   

  

 You want more out of a career. A place to share your ideas freely — even if they’re daring or different. Where the true you can learn, grow, and thrive. At Verizon, we power and empower how people live, work and play by connecting them to what brings them joy. We do what we love — driving innovation, creativity, and impact in the world. Our V Team is a community of people who anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together — lifting our communities and building trust in how we show up, everywhere & always. Want in? Join the #VTeamLife.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing...**
 Exciting opportunities exist within the Verizon Global Presales Engineering organization. As a Solutions Architect, you will be an integral part of a talented team collaborating with our clients’ on their Digital Transformation. You play a meaningful role in building long-term business relationships within assigned enterprise accounts. This is a high-impact role working closely with the Sales team and customers to identify and qualify opportunities and design solutions to address customer business challenges.
   

  

 At Verizon, we do much more than sell technology. We deliver groundbreaking solutions that improve the agility, productivity and global reach of businesses. We lead. Others follow. No-one can match our capability to design, build and operate integrated global networks, cutting-edge information systems and mobile technologies. Are you ready to improve a best in class enterprise sales team that thrives on teamwork and collaboration? Can you see yourself delivering technology and innovative solutions that connect people the world over and transform the way communities live, work and play? Do you want to change the way the world works? Welcome to Verizon – a company you can be proud to represent and be a part of.
   

  

 We’re a leader in transforming enterprises, including 97% of the Fortune 1000. We’re also a business that invests in its people. So as you contribute to our business, we’ll make sure you grow. And get the rewards you deserve. Competitive salaries are enhanced by plenty of incentive awards for sales performance.
   

  

 You will seek to build deep, consultative technical relationships with your customers, effectively becoming a trusted adviser. An SA is ideally positioned to understand the customer's high-level objectives and match these to Verizon solutions in order to satisfy business and technical requirements.
   

  

* Being an integral part of a team to identify and qualify business opportunities and develop the strategy to resolve technical matters.
* Recommending integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices.
* Owning the technical relationship with Verizon customers, including managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources.
* Working directly with customers to create solutions and use cases that leverage Verizon product integrations that generate business value.
* Articulating the Verizon Enterprise vision on technologies and solutions towards the Client; positions Verizon Enterprise as thought leader on key technological developments.
* Leading prioritization of Customer solution / technical requirements and champions resolution of solution / product gaps internally (also towards Product Groups).
* Developing individual skill set and expand product knowledge to maximize value and to deliver quality services to our clients.
* Traveling to Client sites, conferences, and other related events as required.


**What We’re Looking For...**
 You’ll need to have:
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
* Four or more years of relevant experience required, demonstrated through work experience and/or military experience.
* Four or more years of experience in the tech industry, pre-sales, customer-facing, consulting or other relevant technical experience.
* Experience architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable, distributed systems.
* Experience architecting and developing LAN/WAN or large infrastructure and network solutions for enterprise customers.
* Experience with networking concepts including: software defined networking, routing, VPNs, load balancers, and firewalls.
* Knowledge of data and information security - especially as it relates to issues within businesses.
* Experience in two or more of the following areas: Software Defined Networking (SDN), IT infrastructure and systems security, cloud or network systems management, and business continuity.
* Willingness to travel.
* Valid driver's license.


 Even better if you have one or more of the following:
   

  

* MA/MS degree in engineering or computer science.
* Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies and solutions in the cloud/IT technology space.
* Experience running multiple projects or deals under tight timelines.
* Security, architecture, and industry certifications such as AWS Solution Architect, Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK), CompTIA Security+, Cisco Certified Design or Network Associate, ITIL Foundations, or similar.
* Experience implementing or designing two or more of the following: Data and IP Services Managed Operations; Security Services; Call Center Technologies and or IT Applications Management.


 If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.
   

  

 Where you’ll be working
   

  

 In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.
   

  

 Scheduled Weekly Hours
   

  

 40
   

  

 Equal Employment Opportunity
   

  

 Verizon is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, gender, disability or any other legally protected characteristics.

title: Account Executive, LE/GE, GTS
description:
**About Gartner:**
 Are you looking for a fast-paced career with outstanding advancement potential at a global market leader? If so, think about Gartner. The world's leading research and advisory company, Gartner (NYSE:IT) delivers the technology-related insight necessary for our clients to make the right business decisions, every day. We are seeking highly motivated, achievement-driven sales associates to contribute to our double-digit growth, backed by the solid infrastructure of a world-class sales organization. In addition to a competitive base salary, uncapped commissions and exceptional benefits, Gartner sales associates can enjoy generous performance-based rewards, including all expenses paid trips to exotic locations around the world. Come be a part of our incredible growth organization!
   

  

**Position Summary:**
 The Account Executive is a field-based, direct sales role responsible for both client retention as well as growth through contract expansion and the introduction of new products and services. You will consult with C-level executives to develop and implement an effective, enterprise-wide strategy that maximizes the value delivered by Gartner’s products and services.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Account management with an outcome of increased customer satisfaction and an increase in retention and account growth
* Mastery and consistent execution of Gartner’s sales methodology
* Account planning and territory management
* Managing forecast accuracy on a monthly/quarterly/annual basis
* Maintaining competitive knowledge and focus
* In-depth knowledge of Gartner’s products and services


**Requirements:**
* 6-10 years of experience with proven consultative sales, preferably in high technology (services, software, or consultative environment), with evidence of prior success in Sales
* Strong demonstration of intellect, drive, executive presence and sales acumen
* Proven experience building excellent client relationships at C-level within large enterprise organisations
* Strong computer proficiency and presentation skills
* Professional level of Swedish
* Knowledge of the full life cycle of the sales process
* Bachelors or Masters degree – desired


**What Gartner gives you:**
* Market leading earnings potential
* Unbeatable training and growth opportunities, including an intensive 3-week sales academy for new hires
* Excellent corporate benefits
* The opportunity to sell at C-level and work with some of the brightest minds in the industry


 Your application and the data therein are received and processed by Gartner UK Ltd., which is operating as shared HR service provider for the EMEA entities of the Gartner group. Your application will be shared by Gartner UK Ltd. with those persons within the Gartner group which decide about the steps of your application.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability.
